com.poesys.db.dto

Class AbstractBatchUpdateSetter<T extends IDbDto>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.db.dto.AbstractSetter<T>
      • com.poesys.db.dto.AbstractBatchUpdateSetter<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of IDbDto to update
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISet, java.io.Serializable

    public abstract class AbstractBatchUpdateSetter<T extends IDbDto>
extends AbstractSetter<T>
implements ISet
    An abstract implementation of the ISet interface for a Strategy-pattern class that updates a collection of DTOs as part of a more comprehensive transaction, taking in a connection and not closing it. The abstract methods parameterize the class with objects that the set() method uses in processing the batch update.
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        subsystem - the subsystem for the setter

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public void set()
        Description copied from interface: ISet

        Set a field in a Data Transfer Object (DTO). Setting a field can mean either querying data and setting it into the DTO or taking data from the DTO field and setting it into the database. The set can use batch operations, so the caller must be able to handle the BatchException as well as SQLException.

        Specified by:
        set in interface ISet

      • getSql

        protected abstract IUpdateSql<T> getSql()
        Get the SQL object that contains the UPDATE statement.
        Returns:
        the SQL UPDATE object

      • getBatchSize

        protected abstract int getBatchSize()
        Get the JDBC batch size, the number of rows to process in a single batch operation on the server; typically this is the number of rows expected for the list, but for very long lists it can be a partial subset such as 1,000 or 10,000. The objective is to process as many elements at a time as possible while not taking up too much memory for the transfer.
        Returns:
        the batch size

      • getDtos

        protected abstract java.util.List<T> getDtos()
        Get the DTOs that contain the data to update.
        Returns:
        the collection of DTOs

      • isSet

        public boolean isSet()
        Description copied from interface: ISet
        Is the field already set? A client may use this method to test the object of the setter to see whether to run the set method.
        Specified by:
        isSet in interface ISet
        Returns:
        true if set, false if not
